Browse the source code of tvm/3rdparty/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/strtonum.h

1/*!
2 * Copyright (c) 2015-2018 by Contributors
3 * \file strtonum.h
4 * \brief A faster implementation of strtof and strtod
5 */
6#ifndef DMLC_STRTONUM_H_
7#define DMLC_STRTONUM_H_
8
9#if DMLC_USE_CXX11
10#include <type_traits>
11#endif
12
13#include <string>
14#include <limits>
15#include <cstdint>
16#include "./base.h"
17#include "./logging.h"
18
19namespace dmlc {
20/*!
21 * \brief Inline implementation of isspace(). Tests whether the given character
22 * is a whitespace letter.
23 * \param c Character to test
24 * \return Result of the test
25 */
26inline bool isspace(char c) {
27 return (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\r' || c == '\n' || c == '\f');
28}
29
30/*!
31 * \brief Inline implementation of isblank(). Tests whether the given character
32 * is a space or tab character.
33 * \param c Character to test
34 * \return Result of the test
35 */
36inline bool isblank(char c) {
37 return (c == ' ' || c == '\t');
38}
39
40/*!
41 * \brief Inline implementation of isdigit(). Tests whether the given character
42 * is a decimal digit
43 * \param c Character to test
44 * \return Result of the test
45 */
46inline bool isdigit(char c) {
47 return (c >= '0' && c <= '9');
48}
49
50/*!
51 * \brief Inline implementation of isalpha(). Tests whether the given character
52 * is an alphabet letter
53 * \param c Character to test
54 * \return Result of the test
55 */
56inline bool isalpha(char c) {
57 static_assert(
58 static_cast<int>('A') == 65 && static_cast<int>('Z' - 'A') == 25,
59 "Only system with ASCII character set is supported");
60 return (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z') || (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z');
61}
62
63/*!
64 * \brief Tests whether the given character is a valid letter in the string
65 * representation of a floating-point value, i.e. decimal digits,
66 * signs (+/-), decimal point (.), or exponent marker (e/E).
67 * \param c Character to test
68 * \return Result of the test
69 */
70inline bool isdigitchars(char c) {
71 return (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
72 || c == '+' || c == '-'
73 || c == '.'
74 || c == 'e' || c == 'E';
75}
76
77/*!
78 * \brief Maximum number of decimal digits dmlc::strtof() / dmlc::strtod()
79 * will process. Trailing digits will be ignored.
80 */
81const int kStrtofMaxDigits = 19;
82
83/*!
84 * \brief Common implementation for dmlc::strtof() and dmlc::strtod()
85 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
86 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into a
87 * floating-point number
88 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
89 * past the last character used in the conversion.
90 * \return Converted floating-point value, in FloatType
91 * \tparam FloatType Type of floating-point number to be obtained. This must
92 * be either float or double.
93 * \tparam CheckRange Whether to check for overflow. If set to true, an out-
94 * of-range value will cause errno to be set to ERANGE and
95 * ParseFloat() to return HUGE_VAL / HUGE_VALF; otherwise,
96 * all out-of-range vlaues will be silently clipped.
97 */
98template <typename FloatType, bool CheckRange = false>
99inline FloatType ParseFloat(const char* nptr, char** endptr) {
100#if DMLC_USE_CXX11
101 static_assert(std::is_same<FloatType, double>::value
102 || std::is_same<FloatType, float>::value,
103 "ParseFloat is defined only for 'float' and 'double' types");
104 constexpr unsigned kMaxExponent
105 = (std::is_same<FloatType, double>::value ? 308U : 38U);
106 constexpr FloatType kMaxSignificandForMaxExponent
107 = static_cast<FloatType>(std::is_same<FloatType, double>::value
108 ? 1.79769313486231570 : 3.402823466);
109 // If a floating-point value has kMaxExponent, what is
110 // the largest possible significand value?
111 constexpr FloatType kMaxSignificandForNegMaxExponent
112 = static_cast<FloatType>(std::is_same<FloatType, double>::value
113 ? 2.22507385850720139 : 1.175494351);
114 // If a floating-point value has -kMaxExponent, what is
115 // the largest possible significand value?
116#else
117 const unsigned kMaxExponent
118 = (sizeof(FloatType) == sizeof(double) ? 308U : 38U);
119 const FloatType kMaxSignificandForMaxExponent
120 = static_cast<FloatType>(sizeof(FloatType) == sizeof(double)
121 ? 1.79769313486231570 : 3.402823466);
122 const FloatType kMaxSignificandForNegMaxExponent
123 = static_cast<FloatType>(sizeof(FloatType) == sizeof(double)
124 ? 2.22507385850720139 : 1.175494351);
125#endif
126
127 const char *p = nptr;
128 // Skip leading white space, if any. Not necessary
129 while (isspace(*p) ) ++p;
130
131 // Get sign, if any.
132 bool sign = true;
133 if (*p == '-') {
134 sign = false; ++p;
135 } else if (*p == '+') {
136 ++p;
137 }
138
139 // Handle INF and NAN
140 {
141 int i = 0;
142 // case-insensitive match for INF and INFINITY
143 while (i < 8 && static_cast<char>((*p) | 32) == "infinity"[i]) {
144 ++i; ++p;
145 }
146 if (i == 3 || i == 8) {
147 if (endptr) *endptr = (char*)p; // NOLINT(*)
148 return sign ? std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::infinity()
149 : -std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::infinity();
150 } else {
151 p -= i;
152 }
153
154 // case-insensitive match for NAN
155 i = 0;
156 while (i < 3 && static_cast<char>((*p) | 32) == "nan"[i]) {
157 ++i; ++p;
158 }
159 if (i == 3) {
160 // Got NAN; check if the value is of form NAN(char_sequence)
161 if (*p == '(') {
162 ++p;
163 while (isdigit(*p) || isalpha(*p) || *p == '_') ++p;
164 CHECK_EQ(*p, ')') << "Invalid NAN literal";
165 ++p;
166 }
167 static_assert(std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::has_quiet_NaN,
168 "Only system with quiet NaN is supported");
169 if (endptr) *endptr = (char*)p; // NOLINT(*)
170 return std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::quiet_NaN();
171 } else {
172 p -= i;
173 }
174 }
175
176 // Get digits before decimal point or exponent, if any.
177 uint64_t predec; // to store digits before decimal point
178 for (predec = 0; isdigit(*p); ++p) {
179 predec = predec * 10ULL + static_cast<uint64_t>(*p - '0');
180 }
181 FloatType value = static_cast<FloatType>(predec);
182
183 // Get digits after decimal point, if any.
184 if (*p == '.') {
185 uint64_t pow10 = 1;
186 uint64_t val2 = 0;
187 int digit_cnt = 0;
188 ++p;
189 while (isdigit(*p)) {
190 if (digit_cnt < kStrtofMaxDigits) {
191 val2 = val2 * 10ULL + static_cast<uint64_t>(*p - '0');
192 pow10 *= 10ULL;
193 } // when kStrtofMaxDigits is read, ignored following digits
194 ++p;
195 ++digit_cnt;
196 }
197 value += static_cast<FloatType>(
198 static_cast<double>(val2) / static_cast<double>(pow10));
199 }
200
201 // Handle exponent, if any.
202 if ((*p == 'e') || (*p == 'E')) {
203 ++p;
204 bool frac = false;
205 FloatType scale = static_cast<FloatType>(1.0f);
206 unsigned expon;
207 // Get sign of exponent, if any.
208 if (*p == '-') {
209 frac = true;
210 ++p;
211 } else if (*p == '+') {
212 ++p;
213 }
214 // Get digits of exponent, if any.
215 for (expon = 0; isdigit(*p); ++p) {
216 expon = expon * 10U + static_cast<unsigned>(*p - '0');
217 }
218 if (expon > kMaxExponent) { // out of range, clip or raise error
219 if (CheckRange) {
220 errno = ERANGE;
221 if (endptr) *endptr = (char*)p; // NOLINT(*)
222 return std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::infinity();
223 } else {
224 expon = kMaxExponent;
225 }
226 }
227 // handle edge case where exponent is exactly kMaxExponent
228 if (expon == kMaxExponent
229 && ((!frac && value > kMaxSignificandForMaxExponent)
230 || (frac && value < kMaxSignificandForNegMaxExponent))) {
231 if (CheckRange) {
232 errno = ERANGE;
233 if (endptr) *endptr = (char*)p; // NOLINT(*)
234 return std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::infinity();
235 } else {
236 value = (frac ? kMaxSignificandForNegMaxExponent
237 : kMaxSignificandForMaxExponent);
238 }
239 }
240 // Calculate scaling factor.
241 while (expon >= 8U) { scale *= static_cast<FloatType>(1E8f); expon -= 8U; }
242 while (expon > 0U) { scale *= static_cast<FloatType>(10.0f); expon -= 1U; }
243 // Return signed and scaled floating point result.
244 value = frac ? (value / scale) : (value * scale);
245 }
246 // Consume 'f' suffix, if any
247 if (*p == 'f' || *p == 'F') {
248 ++p;
249 }
250
251 if (endptr) *endptr = (char*)p; // NOLINT(*)
252 return sign ? value : - value;
253}
254
255/*!
256 * \brief A faster implementation of strtof(). See documentation of
257 * std::strtof() for more information. Note that this function does not
258 * check for overflow. Use strtof_check_range() to check for overflow.
259 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
260 * TODO: the current version does not handle long decimals: you may only have
261 * up to 19 digits after the decimal point, and you cannot have too many
262 * digits before the decimal point either.
263 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into float
264 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
265 * past the last character used in the conversion.
266 * \return Converted floating-point value, in float type
267 */
268inline float strtof(const char* nptr, char** endptr) {
269 return ParseFloat<float>(nptr, endptr);
270}
271
272/*!
273 * \brief A faster implementation of strtof(). See documentation of
274 * std::strtof() for more information. This function will check for
275 * overflow. If the converted value is outside the range for the float
276 * type, errno is set to ERANGE and HUGE_VALF is returned.
277 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
278 * TODO: the current version does not handle long decimals: you may only have
279 * up to 19 digits after the decimal point, and you cannot have too many
280 * digits before the decimal point either.
281 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into float
282 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
283 * past the last character used in the conversion.
284 * \return Converted floating-point value, in float type
285 */
286inline float strtof_check_range(const char* nptr, char** endptr) {
287 return ParseFloat<float, true>(nptr, endptr);
288}
289
290/*!
291 * \brief A faster implementation of strtod(). See documentation of
292 * std::strtof() for more information. Note that this function does not
293 * check for overflow. Use strtod_check_range() to check for overflow.
294 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
295 * TODO: the current version does not handle long decimals: you may only have
296 * up to 19 digits after the decimal point, and you cannot have too many
297 * digits before the decimal point either.
298 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into double
299 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
300 * past the last character used in the conversion.
301 * \return Converted floating-point value, in double type
302 */
303inline double strtod(const char* nptr, char** endptr) {
304 return ParseFloat<double>(nptr, endptr);
305}
306
307/*!
308 * \brief A faster implementation of strtod(). See documentation of
309 * std::strtod() for more information. This function will check for
310 * overflow. If the converted value is outside the range for the double
311 * type, errno is set to ERANGE and HUGE_VAL is returned.
312 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
313 * TODO: the current version does not handle long decimals: you may only have
314 * up to 19 digits after the decimal point, and you cannot have too many
315 * digits before the decimal point either.
316 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into double
317 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
318 * past the last character used in the conversion.
319 * \return Converted floating-point value, in float type
320 */
321inline double strtod_check_range(const char* nptr, char** endptr) {
322 return ParseFloat<double, true>(nptr, endptr);
323}
324
325/*!
326 * \brief A fast string-to-integer convertor, for signed integers
327 * TODO: the current version supports only base <= 10
328 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into a signed
329 * integer
330 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
331 * past the last character used in the conversion.
332 * \param base Base to use for integer conversion
333 * \return Converted value, in SignedIntType
334 * \tparam SignedIntType Type of signed integer to be obtained.
335 */
336template <typename SignedIntType>
337inline SignedIntType ParseSignedInt(const char* nptr, char** endptr, int base) {
338#ifdef DMLC_USE_CXX11
339 static_assert(std::is_signed<SignedIntType>::value
340 && std::is_integral<SignedIntType>::value,
341 "ParseSignedInt is defined for signed integers only");
342#endif
343 CHECK(base <= 10 && base >= 2);
344 const char* p = nptr;
345 // Skip leading white space, if any. Not necessary
346 while (isspace(*p) ) ++p;
347
348 // Get sign if any
349 bool sign = true;
350 if (*p == '-') {
351 sign = false; ++p;
352 } else if (*p == '+') {
353 ++p;
354 }
355
356 SignedIntType value;
357 const SignedIntType base_val = static_cast<SignedIntType>(base);
358 for (value = 0; isdigit(*p); ++p) {
359 value = value * base_val + static_cast<SignedIntType>(*p - '0');
360 }
361
362 if (endptr) *endptr = (char*)p; // NOLINT(*)
363 return sign ? value : - value;
364}
365
366/*!
367 * \brief A fast string-to-integer convertor, for unsigned integers
368 * TODO: the current version supports only base <= 10
369 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into an unsigned
370 * integer
371 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
372 * past the last character used in the conversion.
373 * \param base Base to use for integer conversion
374 * \return Converted value, in UnsignedIntType
375 * \tparam UnsignedIntType Type of unsigned integer to be obtained.
376 */
377template <typename UnsignedIntType>
378inline UnsignedIntType ParseUnsignedInt(const char* nptr, char** endptr, int base) {
379#ifdef DMLC_USE_CXX11
380 static_assert(std::is_unsigned<UnsignedIntType>::value
381 && std::is_integral<UnsignedIntType>::value,
382 "ParseUnsignedInt is defined for unsigned integers only");
383#endif
384 CHECK(base <= 10 && base >= 2);
385 const char *p = nptr;
386 // Skip leading white space, if any. Not necessary
387 while (isspace(*p)) ++p;
388
389 // Get sign if any
390 bool sign = true;
391 if (*p == '-') {
392 sign = false; ++p;
393 } else if (*p == '+') {
394 ++p;
395 }
396
397 // we are parsing unsigned, so no minus sign should be found
398 CHECK_EQ(sign, true);
399
400 UnsignedIntType value;
401 const UnsignedIntType base_val = static_cast<UnsignedIntType>(base);
402 for (value = 0; isdigit(*p); ++p) {
403 value = value * base_val + static_cast<UnsignedIntType>(*p - '0');
404 }
405
406 if (endptr) *endptr = (char*)p; // NOLINT(*)
407 return value;
408}
409
410/*!
411 * \brief A faster implementation of strtoull(). See documentation of
412 * std::strtoull() for more information. Note that this function does not
413 * check for overflow.
414 * TODO: the current version supports only base <= 10
415 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into integer of
416 * type unsigned long long
417 * \param endptr After the conversion, this pointer will be set to point one
418 * past the last character used in the conversion.
419 * \param base Base to use for integer conversion
420 * \return Converted value, as unsigned 64-bit integer
421 */
422inline uint64_t strtoull(const char* nptr, char **endptr, int base) {
423 return ParseUnsignedInt<uint64_t>(nptr, endptr, base);
424}
425
426/*!
427 * \brief A faster implementation of atol(). See documentation of std::atol()
428 * for more information. This function will use base 10. Note that this
429 * function does not check for overflow.
430 * \param p Beginning of the string that's to be converted into integer of
431 * type long
432 * \return Converted value, as long integer (width is system-dependent)
433 */
434inline long atol(const char* p) { // NOLINT(*)
435 return ParseSignedInt<long>(p, 0, 10); // NOLINT(*)
436}
437
438/*!
439 * \brief A faster implementation of atof(). Unlike std::atof(), this function
440 * returns float type. Note that this function does not check for overflow.
441 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
442 * TODO: the current version does not handle long decimals: you may only have
443 * up to 19 digits after the decimal point, and you cannot have too many
444 * digits before the decimal point either.
445 * \param nptr Beginning of the string that's to be converted into float
446 * \return Converted value, in float type
447 */
448inline float atof(const char* nptr) {
449 return strtof(nptr, 0);
450}
451
452/*!
453 * \brief A faster implementation of stof(). See documentation of std::stof()
454 * for more information. This function will test for overflow and
455 * invalid arguments.
456 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
457 * TODO: the current version does not handle long decimals: you may only have
458 * up to 19 digits after the decimal point, and you cannot have too many
459 * digits before the decimal point either.
460 * \param value The string to convert into float
461 * \param pos If not null, it will store the number of characters processed
462 * \return Converted value, in float type
463 * \throw std::out_of_range If the converted value would fall out of the range
464 * of the double type
465 * \throw std::invalid_argument If no conversion could be performed
466 */
467inline float stof(const std::string& value, size_t* pos = nullptr) {
468 const char* str_source = value.c_str();
469 char* endptr;
470 const float parsed_value = dmlc::strtof_check_range(str_source, &endptr);
471 if (errno == ERANGE && parsed_value == std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity()) {
472 throw std::out_of_range("Out of range value");
473 } else if (const_cast<const char*>(endptr) == str_source) {
474 throw std::invalid_argument("No conversion could be performed");
475 }
476 if (pos) {
477 *pos = static_cast<size_t>(const_cast<const char*>(endptr) - str_source);
478 }
479 return parsed_value;
480}
481
482/*!
483 * \brief A faster implementation of stod(). See documentation of std::stod()
484 * for more information. This function will test for overflow and
485 * invalid arguments.
486 * TODO: the current version does not support hex number
487 * TODO: the current version does not handle long decimals: you may only have
488 * up to 19 digits after the decimal point, and you cannot have too many
489 * digits before the decimal point either.
490 * \param value The string to convert into double
491 * \param pos If not null, it will store the number of characters processed
492 * \return Converted value, in double type
493 * \throw std::out_of_range If the converted value would fall out of the range
494 * of the double type
495 * \throw std::invalid_argument If no conversion could be performed
496 */
497inline double stod(const std::string& value, size_t* pos = nullptr) {
498 const char* str_source = value.c_str();
499 char* endptr;
500 const double parsed_value = dmlc::strtod_check_range(str_source, &endptr);
501 if (errno == ERANGE && parsed_value == std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()) {
502 throw std::out_of_range("Out of range value");
503 } else if (const_cast<const char*>(endptr) == str_source) {
504 throw std::invalid_argument("No conversion could be performed");
505 }
506 if (pos) {
507 *pos = static_cast<size_t>(const_cast<const char*>(endptr) - str_source);
508 }
509 return parsed_value;
510}
511
512/*!
513 * \brief Interface class that defines a single method get() to convert
514 * a string into type T. Define template specialization of this class
515 * to define the conversion method for a particular type.
516 * \tparam Type of converted value
517 */
518template<typename T>
519class Str2T {
520 public:
521 /*!
522 * \brief Convert a string into type T
523 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
524 * \param end End of the string to convert
525 * \return Converted value, in type T
526 */
527 static inline T get(const char * begin, const char * end);
528};
529
530/*!
531 * \brief Convenience function for converting string into type T
532 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
533 * \param end End of the string to convert
534 * \return Converted value, in type T
535 * \tparam Type of converted value
536 */
537template<typename T>
538inline T Str2Type(const char * begin, const char * end) {
539 return Str2T<T>::get(begin, end);
540}
541
542/*!
543 * \brief Template specialization of Str2T<> interface for signed 32-bit integer
544 */
545template<>
546class Str2T<int32_t> {
547 public:
548 /*!
549 * \brief Convert a string into signed 32-bit integer
550 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
551 * \param end End of the string to convert
552 * \return Converted value, as signed 32-bit integer
553 */
554 static inline int32_t get(const char * begin, const char * end) {
555 return ParseSignedInt<int32_t>(begin, NULL, 10);
556 }
557};
558
559/*!
560 * \brief Template specialization of Str2T<> interface for unsigned 32-bit integer
561 */
562template<>
563class Str2T<uint32_t> {
564 public:
565 /*!
566 * \brief Convert a string into unsigned 32-bit integer
567 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
568 * \param end End of the string to convert
569 * \return Converted value, as unsigned 32-bit integer
570 */
571 static inline uint32_t get(const char* begin, const char* end) {
572 return ParseUnsignedInt<uint32_t>(begin, NULL, 10);
573 }
574};
575
576/*!
577 * \brief Template specialization of Str2T<> interface for signed 64-bit integer
578 */
579template<>
580class Str2T<int64_t> {
581 public:
582 /*!
583 * \brief Convert a string into signed 64-bit integer
584 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
585 * \param end End of the string to convert
586 * \return Converted value, as signed 64-bit integer
587 */
588 static inline int64_t get(const char * begin, const char * end) {
589 return ParseSignedInt<int64_t>(begin, NULL, 10);
590 }
591};
592
593/*!
594 * \brief Template specialization of Str2T<> interface for unsigned 64-bit integer
595 */
596template<>
597class Str2T<uint64_t> {
598 public:
599 /*!
600 * \brief Convert a string into unsigned 64-bit integer
601 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
602 * \param end End of the string to convert
603 * \return Converted value, as unsigned 64-bit integer
604 */
605 static inline uint64_t get(const char * begin, const char * end) {
606 return ParseUnsignedInt<uint64_t>(begin, NULL, 10);
607 }
608};
609
610/*!
611 * \brief Template specialization of Str2T<> interface for float type
612 */
613template<>
614class Str2T<float> {
615 public:
616 /*!
617 * \brief Convert a string into float
618 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
619 * \param end End of the string to convert
620 * \return Converted value, in float type
621 */
622 static inline float get(const char * begin, const char * end) {
623 return atof(begin);
624 }
625};
626
627/*!
628 * \brief Template specialization of Str2T<> interface for double type
629 */
630template<>
631class Str2T<double> {
632 public:
633 /*!
634 * \brief Convert a string into double
635 * \param begin Beginning of the string to convert
636 * \param end End of the string to convert
637 * \return Converted value, in double type
638 */
639 static inline double get(const char * begin, const char * end) {
640 return strtod(begin, 0);
641 }
642};
643
644/*!
645 * \brief Parse colon seperated pair v1[:v2]
646 * \param begin pointer to string
647 * \param end one past end of string
648 * \param endptr After conversion, will be set to one past of parsed string
649 * \param v1 first value in the pair
650 * \param v2 second value in the pair
651 * \return number of values parsed
652 * \tparam T1 type of v1
653 * \tparam T2 type of v2
654 */
655template<typename T1, typename T2>
656inline int ParsePair(const char * begin, const char * end,
657 const char ** endptr, T1 &v1, T2 &v2) { // NOLINT(*)
658 const char * p = begin;
659 while (p != end && !isdigitchars(*p)) ++p;
660 if (p == end) {
661 *endptr = end;
662 return 0;
663 }
664 const char * q = p;
665 while (q != end && isdigitchars(*q)) ++q;
666 v1 = Str2Type<T1>(p, q);
667 p = q;
668 while (p != end && isblank(*p)) ++p;
669 if (p == end || *p != ':') {
670 // only v1
671 *endptr = p;
672 return 1;
673 }
674 p++;
675 while (p != end && !isdigitchars(*p)) ++p;
676 q = p;
677 while (q != end && isdigitchars(*q)) ++q;
678 *endptr = q;
679 v2 = Str2Type<T2>(p, q);
680 return 2;
681}
682
683/*!
684 * \brief Parse colon seperated triple v1:v2[:v3]
685 * \param begin pointer to string
686 * \param end one past end of string
687 * \param endptr After conversion, will be set to one past of parsed string
688 * \param v1 first value in the triple
689 * \param v2 second value in the triple
690 * \param v3 third value in the triple
691 * \return number of values parsed
692 * \tparam T1 type of v1
693 * \tparam T2 type of v2
694 * \tparam T3 type of v3
695 */
696template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>
697inline int ParseTriple(const char * begin, const char * end,
698 const char ** endptr, T1 &v1, T2 &v2, T3 &v3) { // NOLINT(*)
699 const char * p = begin;
700 while (p != end && !isdigitchars(*p)) ++p;
701 if (p == end) {
702 *endptr = end;
703 return 0;
704 }
705 const char * q = p;
706 while (q != end && isdigitchars(*q)) ++q;
707 v1 = Str2Type<T1>(p, q);
708 p = q;
709 while (p != end && isblank(*p)) ++p;
710 if (p == end || *p != ':') {
711 // only v1
712 *endptr = p;
713 return 1;
714 }
715 p++;
716 while (p != end && !isdigitchars(*p)) ++p;
717 q = p;
718 while (q != end && isdigitchars(*q)) ++q;
719 v2 = Str2Type<T2>(p, q);
720 p = q;
721 while (p != end && isblank(*p)) ++p;
722 if (p == end || *p != ':') {
723 // only v1:v2
724 *endptr = p;
725 return 2;
726 }
727 p++;
728 while (p != end && !isdigitchars(*p)) ++p;
729 q = p;
730 while (q != end && isdigitchars(*q)) ++q;
731 *endptr = q;
732 v3 = Str2Type<T3>(p, q);
733 return 3;
734}
735} // namespace dmlc
736
737#endif // DMLC_STRTONUM_H_
738
